column4: Twitter shares fall as growth of monthly users slows
column5: Twitter Inc's  shares fell more than 11 percent in extended trade on Tuesday after the microblogging company said its number of monthly average users grew at the slowest pace since it went public in 2013.

column4: United Airlines data breached by China-backed hackers: Bloomberg
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc has been the target of a data breach linked to a group of China-backed hackers  Bloomberg reported.

column4: United Airlines data breached by China-backed hackers - Bloomberg
column5: July 29 United Continental Holdings Inc  has been the target of a data breach linked to a group of China-backed hackers  Bloomberg reported.

column4: Merchants seek to void $6 billion Visa  MasterCard  AmEx settlements
column5: NEW YORK Dozens of retailers are seeking to void nearly $6 billion of U.S. antitrust settlements with Visa Inc   MasterCard Inc  and American Express Co  after learning that opposing lawyers exchanged confidential information  potentially tainting the accords.

column4: Merchants seek to void $6 bln Visa  MasterCard  AmEx settlements
column5: NEW YORK  July 29 Dozens of retailers are seeking to void nearly $6 billion of U.S. antitrust settlements with Visa Inc  MasterCard Inc and American Express Co after learning that opposing lawyers exchanged confidential information  potentially tainting the accords.

column4: Whiting cuts budget less than two weeks after raising it
column5: Whiting Petroleum Corp cut its 2015 budget on Wednesday less than two weeks after raising it  a turnaround that underscores the uncertainty engulfing the energy industry while crude prices sit roughly 50 percent below last year's levels.

column4: Whiting posts quarterly loss as low oil prices offset output jump
column5: July 29 Whiting Petroleum Corp  North Dakota's largest oil producer  posted a quarterly net loss on Wednesday as plunging crude prices offset a production jump.

column4: French court clears XPO to press ahead with Norbert merger
column5: PARIS A Paris commercial court gave U.S. group XPO Logistics the green light on Wednesday to proceed with its post-purchase integration of French transport firm Norbert Dentressangle   throwing out an injunction sought by a U.S. hedge fund.

column4: French court clears XPO to press ahead with Norbert merger
column5: PARIS  July 29 A Paris commercial court gave U.S. group XPO Logistics the green light on Wednesday to proceed with its post-purchase integration of French transport firm Norbert Dentressangle  throwing out an injunction sought by a U.S. hedge fund.

column4: Yelp needs help  and buyout may be the answer
column5: Selling itself could be one of the few options left for Yelp Inc   which is struggling to win advertising dollars in an increasingly crowded market that already includes Google Inc   TripAdvisor Inc  and GrubHub Inc .
